description: From French déplumer, from Latin dēplūmō, from dē- + plūmō (“to cover with feathers”), from plūma (“feather”). Compare dēplūmis (“featherless”).

verbs.description: deplume (third-person singular simple present deplumes, present participle depluming, simple past and past participle deplumed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To strip of feathers or plumage.
examples: On the depluming of the pope every bird had his own feather.

entries.meaning: (transitive, figuratively) To lay bare; to expose.
examples: the exposure and depluming  […]  of the leading humbugs of the age
